dmca.title: First Follow-up; dvdplayerrule.com ISP Letter
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

The URLs in question are currently not accessible as of 9:45:42 a.m. (GMT-6) on June
23, 2006.

 

Legal Response Team

The Planet


________________________________

From: Raul Torres [mailto:raul@netenforcers.com] 
Posted At: Tuesday, June 20, 2006 3:00 PM
Posted To: Legal Response
Conversation: First Follow-up; dvdplayerrule.com ISP Letter
Subject: First Follow-up; dvdplayerrule.com ISP Letter


To Whom It May Concern:


This is in regards to a Cease and Desist letter which was sent to you regarding your
client dvdplayerrule.com and our client Sony specifically with their home video
products division. Your client received a DMCA Notification informing them of the
unauthorized use of copyrighted images and trademarked logos. Upon receiving the
letter, the infringer was given eight (8) days to comply. The website has been
rechecked and I am showing your client has yet to comply. This notice was also sent
to you on May 25, 2006. Please find these letters attached and provide me with a
follow-up on this by June 22, 2006. If you have any questions please do not hesitate
to contact me via email at raul@netenforcers.com.

________________________________

Phoenix Office:


Ellis & Venable


101 N. First Avenue, Suite 1875


Phoenix, Arizona 85003

voice: (602) 631-9393

fax: (602) 631-9796

 

5-25-2006

 



 

VIA CERTIFIED US MAIL

RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED

 

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

1333 North Stemmons Freeway Suite 110
Dallas, TX 75207



Re:      Unauthorized Use of Sony's Trademarks and/or Copyrighted Materials

 

Dear Designated Agent:

 

We have been retained by our client, Net Enforcers, Inc., to contact you with
respect to unauthorized use of Sony's trademarks and/or copyrighted materials.  

 

Sony has retained Net Enforcers to assist with the protection and enforcement of its
rights in Sony-owned or licensed trademarks, logos, and other copyrighted materials.
 Net Enforcers has in turn retained us to assist with this matter.  Pursuant to 17
U.S.C.
